pageContext.claim: “Now, Obama[care] has something that’s very, very bad. Where you have to pay a penalty. And people don't realize, how many people are forced to pay a penalty and they don’t get any benefit out of it. We don’t have that. We’re going to have much lower premiums and we’re going to have much lower deductibles.”
pageContext.analysis: The House Republican plan does get rid of the fine for people who fail to buy coverage, but it still increases premiums by 30 percent one year for people who don't maintain continuous coverage.
